channel.title: ARCserve News
channel.description: News for the last one year

item.title: CA Executive to Discuss Cloud Computing’s Role in Data Protection at Storage Expo
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y. October 8, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) today announced that Don Kleinschnitz, senior vice president, software engineering for CA’s Recovery Management business unit, will be presenting on where cloud-based data protection fits in customers’ storage strategies at the Storage Expo in London on October 14 and 15.

item.title: CA ARCserve Backup Beats Symantec Backup Exec Again in Comparative Review
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y. September 21, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) today announced CA ARCserve® Backup came out on top again against Symantec™ Backup Exec™ in an independent study conducted by North American software reseller Productive Corporation. Productive found that the features and technology in CA ARCserve Backup “clearly are beyond what Symantec's Backup Exec has to...

item.title: CA ARCserve Backup and CA XOsoft High Availability Chosen as Best Channel Products in Business Solutions Magazine Survey
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y. September 16, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) today announced that CA ARCserve Backup® and CA XOsoft™ High Availability were named among the Best Channel Products for Backup & Disaster Recovery and Data Protection in a survey of Value-Added Resellers (VARs) conducted by Business Solutions magazine.

item.title: CA ARCserve Backup Beats Backup Exec in Comparative Review
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y. September 10, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) today announced CA ARCserve® Backup beat Symantec™ Backup Exec™ by a large margin in a competitive review conducted by Network Testing Labs (NTL), scoring much higher overall and in individual categories for backup, restore, application availability, performance, ease-of-use, and deployment.

item.title: U.S. Air Force 45th Space Wing Launches Successful Virtualization Initiative Using CA ARCserve Backup and CA XOsoft Cloud-Based Replication to Help Meet Cost Cutting and Service Objectives
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y., August 31, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) CA today announced that the U.S. Air Force 45th Space Wing (45th SW), which manages launch operations for Department of Defense space programs, has saved at least $180,000* in hardware and support costs by virtualizing its IT infrastructure, using CA ARCserve Backup to protect data across physical and virtual servers and CA XOsoft...

item.title: CRN's Magazine Top 100 Women in the Channel for 2009
item.description: Tracy Balent-Hamrac and Toni Clayton-Hine recognized by Everything Channel’s CRN Magazine as one of the Top 100 Women in the Channel for 2009.The Top 100 Women in the Channel was chosen by the editors of the magazine based on their achievements as executives and the amount of influence they wield over the technology channel. The Top 100 Women in the Channel represent a changing trend in a...

item.title: CA Named #1 Channel Contender
item.description: In CRN’s July issue, CA came in as the #1 Channel Contender in the Data Protection Software Category. "CA enjoys the title of top Channel Contender in the data protection software market because it, like leading vendor Symantec/Veritas, is a major software vendor not tied to any specific hardware offerings. While VARs have said CA's channel programs have been inconsistent over...

item.title: Cost-Effective, High-Availability on Virtualized Servers for SMBs
item.description: Bennett Klein, Product Marketing Manager for CA's Recovery Management Business Unit, talks about how many IT organizations, including SMBs, are using server virtualization to help reduce IT costs, make IT more productive and help reduce environmental impact through green computing.

item.title: Cloud Data Backup Caution is Advised by New CA Recovery Management Head Don Kleinschnitz
item.description: Don Kleinschnitz became the senior vice president of engineering at CA Inc. last month, and has been charged with leading a new product development team overseeing strategy, design and launch of new data recovery management products.

item.title: CA Honored as Microsoft Global ISV Infrastructure Partner of the Year
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y. July 7, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) today announced that it has been selected as the 2009 Microsoft Worldwide Partner Conference Awards winner in the Global ISV Infrastructure Partner of the Year category. CA was chosen out of an international field of top Microsoft partners as delivering market-leading customer solutions built on Microsoft technology.

item.title: CA ARCserve Backup Day One Support for VMware vSphere 4 Helps Reduce Backup Windows and Disk Storage Requirements
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y. June 15, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) today announced that CA ARCserve Backup leverages VMware vSphere™ 4 to simplify and speed backups, extending the business benefits of VMware’s next-generation virtualization platform.

item.title: IT Pro Awards CA ARCserve® Backup r12.5 with 5 Stars
item.description: IT PRO - May 14, 2009Data deduplication is becoming a popular choice for many businesses looking to save on storage costs and CA’s latest ARCserve Backup r12.5 takes a great leap forward in this regard. It’s the first backup software product to integrate this technology as a core component - and at no extra cost.

item.title: CA Adds In-Line De-Dupe to DR Suite
item.description: CA rolled out major upgrades to parts of its CA Recovery Management software suite, adding data de-duplication capabilities for backing up data and virtual machines, a new one-step file recovery process, and better storage resource management features that provide more detail on physical and virtual storage assets.The software suite includes new versions of ARCserve Backup, XOsoft High...

item.title: CA Gives Away Dedupe, Backup Reporting
item.description: "The inclusion of key features at no additional cost is a bold move," said Enterprise Strategy Group analyst Lauren Whitehouse. "It definitely helps CA stand out in a crowded market."

item.title: CA Delivers Comprehensive Recovery Management to Support Data Storage, Backup and Recovery
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y., April 27, 2009 – CA, Inc. (NASDAQ: CA) today announced a major new release of CA Recovery Management designed to help customers meet data protection, business continuity and disaster recovery challenges in tough economic times. Virtualization enhancements, built-in data deduplication and Storage Resource Management (SRM), and innovative ways to help ensure recoverability of...

item.title: CA Global Study Reveals Most Companies are Willing to Switch Backup Vendors for Integrated Recovery Management
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y., April 6, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) today announced the results of a global study indicating that while most enterprise and SMB IT organizations are satisfied with their current backup product, 70% of them would consider switching to backup that is integrated with other key recovery management functions, including replication and continuous data protection (CDP). The study...

item.title: New CA Storage Management Releases Help Customers Reduce IT Costs, Improve Data Protection and Address Compliance Across the Enterprise
item.description: ISLANDIA, N.Y., March 16, 2009 – CA (NASDAQ: CA) today announced new versions of its storage resource management software for mainframe and distributed systems that help customers reduce the cost of supporting their complex storage environments and address critical data protection and compliance objectives.

item.title: CA Unveils Channel-Exclusive SaaS Offering At Annual Conference
item.description: CA has developed an on-demand business continuity and disaster recovery service that it will sell exclusively through the channel, the company announced this week at its CA World 2008 user and channel partner conference in Las Vegas.

item.title: CA unveils simplified suite, SaaS portfolio
item.description: CA this week introduced a slew of product enhancements that industry watchers say reflect how enterprise IT executives want to buy management software now: as integrated bundles and via subscription.

item.title: CA World 2008: Not the Same Old Computer Associates
item.description: In CA 3.0, current CEO John Swainson (an IBM veteran) has gradually restored CA’s credibility with Wall Street, customers and partners. In particular, Swainson certainly seems to have earned Wall Street’s trust.

item.title: CA’s Instant Recovery On Demand Helps SMBs Meet Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Requirements
item.description: CA WORLD 2008, LAS VEGAS, November 16, 2008 – CA, Inc. (NASDAQ: CA) today announced CA Instant Recovery On Demand, a new turn-key business continuity (BC) and disaster recovery (DR) service that helps small-to-medium businesses (SMBs) ensure continuous availability of applications and data, even in the event of a critical systems failure or disaster, without additional IT infrastructure...
